Method Detail

exportStart

public void exportStart(java.awt.Dimension totalSize,
                        java.util.Vector la,
                        int grid)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Called at the beginning of the export phase. Ideally, in this routine there should be the code to write the header of the file on which the drawing should be exported.

Specified by:
exportStart in interface ExportInterface
Parameters:
totalSize - the size of the image. Useful to calculate for example the bounding box.
la - a LayerDesc vector describing the attributes of each layer.
grid - the grid size
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportAdvText

public void exportAdvText(int x,
                          int y,
                          int sizex,
                          int sizey,
                          java.lang.String fontname,
                          boolean isBold,
                          boolean isMirrored,
                          boolean isItalic,
                          int orientation,
                          int layer,
                          java.lang.String text)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Called when exporting an Advanced Text primitive.

Specified by:
exportAdvText in interface ExportInterface
Parameters:
x - the x position of the beginning of the string to be written
y - the y position of the beginning of the string to be written
sizex - the x size of the font to be used
sizey - the y size of the font to be used
fontname - the font to be used
isBold - true if the text should be written with a boldface font
isMirrored - true if the text should be mirrored
isItalic - true if the text should be written with an italic font
orientation - angle of orientation (degrees)
layer - the layer that should be used
text - the text that should be written
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportMacro

public boolean exportMacro(int x,
                           int y,
                           boolean isMirrored,
                           int orientation,
                           java.lang.String macroName,
                           java.lang.String macroDesc,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           int xn,
                           int yn,
                           java.lang.String value,
                           int xv,
                           int yv)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Called when exporting a Macro call. This function can just return false, to indicate that the macro should be rendered by means of calling the other primitives. Please note that a macro does not have a reference layer, since it is defined by its components.

Specified by:
exportMacro in interface ExportInterface
Parameters:
x - the x position of the position of the macro
y - the y position of the position of the macro
isMirrored - true if the macro is mirrored
orientation - the macro orientation in degrees
macroName - the macro name
macroDesc - the macro description, in the FidoCad format
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportOval

public void exportOval(int x1,
                       int y1,
                       int x2,
                       int y2,
                       boolean isFilled,
                       int layer)
                throws java.io.IOException
Called when exporting an Oval primitive. Specify the bounding box.

Specified by:
exportOval in interface ExportInterface
Parameters:
x1 - the x position of the first corner
y1 - the y position of the first corner
x2 - the x position of the second corner
y2 - the y position of the second corner
isFilled - it is true if the oval should be filled
layer - the layer that should be used
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                         int siy,
                         int indiam,
                         int layer,
                         boolean onlyHole)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Called when exporting a PCBPad primitive.

Specified by:
exportPCBPad in interface ExportInterface
Parameters:
x - the x position of the pad
y - the y position of the pad
style - the style of the pad (0: oval, 1: square, 2: rounded square)
six - the x size of the pad
siy - the y size of the pad
indiam - the hole internal diameter
layer - the layer that should be used
Throws:
java.io.IOException

isFilled - true if the polygon is filled
layer - the layer that should be used
